alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 15 at 3:06AM PST until February 15 at 10:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Plan on slippery road conditions, including during the evening commute. Damage to trees and power lines is possible. Snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches from 4500 to 6500 feet and 3 to 6 inches above 6500 feet. Areas of southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 60 mph with strongest winds through the afternoon. * WHERE...San Bernardino County Mountains. * WHEN...Noon to 10 PM today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for slick roads and reduced visibilities.. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. For road condition information in California...enter 8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or 9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California.
